title.value: Bayesian Imaging for Radio Interferometry with Score-Based Priors
title.justification: This is the title of the paper as provided in the document details.
title.quote: Bayesian Imaging for Radio Interferometry with Score-Based Priors No√© Dia1,2,4 M. J. Yantovski-Barth1,2,4 Alexandre Adam1,2,4 Micah Bowles5 1,2,3,4 5,6 1,2,3,4,7,8 Pablo Lemos Anna M. M. Scaife Yashar Hezaveh Laurence Perreault-Levasseur1,2,3,4,7,8 1

extractions.description: The paper discusses a novel method for Bayesian imaging for radio interferometry using score-based generative models as priors. The proposed approach uses optical images of galaxies to infer images of protoplanetary disks and demonstrates competitive results compared to state-of-the-art algorithms in radio interferometry.

type.justification: The paper introduces a new method and validates it using real observational data from the DSHARP survey and other datasets.
type.quote: In this work, we use score-based generative models [14, 15] as principled priors [16] to perform Bayesian inference for radio interferometric imaging... We test our pipeline on ALMA observations of 3 DSHARP protoplanetary disks [17] as first application of this method to radio interferometry data.

name.justification: The paper focuses on using deep learning techniques, specifically score-based generative models, for Bayesian image reconstruction.
name.quote: In this work, we use score-based generative models [14, 15] as principled priors [16] to perform Bayesian inference for radio interferometric imaging.

name.justification: The approach revolves around Bayesian inference using score-based generative models as priors.
name.quote: We use score-based priors derived from optical images of galaxies to recover images of protoplanetary disks from the DSHARP survey.

name.justification: The U-net architecture is used as part of the neural network for denoising score matching.
name.quote: In summary, we train a neural network based on the U-net architecture [25] with a weighted Fisher divergence loss.

name.justification: The DSHARP survey data is used for validating the proposed method by recovering images of protoplanetary disks.
name.quote: We test our pipeline on ALMA observations of 3 DSHARP protoplanetary disks [17] as first application of this method to radio interferometry data.

name.justification: The PROBES dataset is used to train the prior score models.
name.quote: The PROBES dataset is a compendium of high-quality local late-type galaxies [33, 34] that we leverage as a prior for our reconstructions.

name.justification: The SKIRT dataset is another dataset used for training prior models and comparing different prior distributions.
name.quote: The SKIRT TNG [36] dataset is a large public collection of images spanning 0.3-5 microns made by applying dust radiative transfer post-processing.

name.justification: PyTorch is referenced as the deep learning framework used in the research.
